header.headertext: AMENDMENTS TO BE MOVED IN COMMITTEE

text.quote: 000: Clause 1, page 1, line 10, at end insert “and the Secretary of State has given the person notice in writing of the date and approximate time of their removal”
000: Clause 1, page 2, leave out lines 28 and 29 and insert “the notice to be given to a family member who is to be removed, and”
000: Before Clause 3, insert the following new Clause—

(1) In the event of an application for bail from detention, an immigration office or the First-Tier Tribunal must release the detained person on bail unless the First-Tier Tribunal is satisfied that there are substantial grounds for belief that if released the person would—
text.IndentOne: (a) fail to comply with one or more of the conditions of bail or of any recognisance or bond, or
(b) while on bail commit an offence which is punishable by imprisonment.
text.quote: (2) In subsection (1), “detention” has the same meaning as in Schedules 2 and 3 to the Immigration Act 1971.”
000: Clause 3, page 3, line 30, at end insert—
“( ) In paragraph 30 (restrictions on grant of bail pending appeal) omit sub-paragraph (2)(d) and (e).”
000: Clause 3, page 3, line 31, leave out subsection (6)
000: Clause 8, page 5, leave out lines 27 to 29
000: Clause 10, page 6, line 41, leave out “or injury”
000: Schedule 3, page 61, line 31, leave out from “occupation” to the end of line 12 on page 62 and insert “in residential premises between—
text.IndentOne: (a) landlord, as defined in subsection (3) of section 15; and
(b) an applicant for a Tier 4 visa holding a Certificate of Acceptance of Studies issued by a body listed in the schedule to the Education (Recognised Bodies) (England) Order 2013 (S.I. 2013/2992)”

text.quote: 000: Schedule 3, page 61, line 33, leave out from “students” to end of line 12 on page 62

000: Schedule 3, page 62, line 1, leave out from “that” to end of line 4 and insert “agreements with one or more institutions or bodies of the kind mentioned in sub-paragraph (2) have the effect that the majority of the persons who are to occupy the accommodation in the building are students”
000: Clause 60, lord Pannick gives notice of his intention to oppose the Question that Clause 60 stand part of the Bill.
